reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is one street off the main road and comprised 3 "buidings" - the original house, a converted shop and a newish extension. The original part is a lovely old building. Check in was quick and our rooms were in the old part of the hotel. Reception is "oldy worldy" with an assortment of chairs and sofas.
reviews.title: Handy for touring the area

reviews.text: There is no lift. We booked 2 rooms - number 5 and 6 - both facing the road. Rooms are spacious with high ceilings and an ensuite toilet, 3/4 bath with shower. Toilet came with shampoo, bath gel and soap. Not a fan of small baths. Could do with a brighter light in the toilet of room 5!

reviews.title: Tidy place.
Why does this town close at 6?
reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel. It was a bit of a labyrinth, and the doors and floors were squeaky in the hallways which was very annoying. Nonetheless, the hotel was very nice. I was disappointed that the whole town of Thurso seems to close at 6pm. There were a couple pubs opened, but that was it. There are a lot of tuner cars running the streets, which was a bit annoying. What else could the kids do, since everything closes so early. I would recommend this hotel. It is close to the Orkney Island ferry, and I'm not sure if there are places on the islands to stay. Next time I go up, I will be looking for a place on the islands. Beautiful part of the world!

reviews.title: Comfortable & pleasant hotel
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here as part of our coach tour of the north of Scotland. Although a little tired & in some need of an update, it was very comfortable. We were happy with our room & although at the front of the hotel, with no double glazing, we were not disturbed by road noise. There were no church bells either as reported by previous contributors !

reviews.title: Busy times
reviews.text: We had lovely food throughout our stay and all the staff were really pleasant & helpful. A bonus on our first night was a parade by the Thurso Pipe Band, who were celebrating 100 years since they were formed. They played up & down the road outside the dining room making a delightful accompanment to our meal & we were able to continue watching & listening after dinner!

reviews.title: Nice Location but Needs Some Work
reviews.text: All in all I would say that the Pentland was our favourite hotel out of the 4 we stayed in during our holiday

reviews.title: Good enough, I guess
reviews.text: My room was spotlessly clean even if the decor was tired. The towels sheets and so on were fresh and clean. The staff that I had dealings with were mostly very pleasant and helpful. the breakfast was excellent. Very good. The evening meal the previous evening was a disaster which was avoidable. The dining room was set for a large party, and I was dining early before they had sat to dinner. I ordered haddock and chips and I suspect that there was no chef at the time or that the chef was busily engaged preparing the meals for the large party I have mentioned. I suspect that the waitress herself made my meal. It was definitely the worst fish I have ever been offered. It resembled cotton wool between two thin dark cardboards! I would have much preferred to have been told that it wasn't convenient for me to dine that evening due to ... whatever. As I have said, bed and breakfast was very good and good value.
